title: Sole Meunière
description: Classic French pan-fried sole coated in flour and finished with a nutty brown butter, lemon, and parsley sauce. Delicate, flaky fish gets a crisp, golden exterior and bright citrus-herb lift for an elegant yet simple dinner.

ingredients.notes: about 120 g (4 oz) per fillet; pat dry
1 tbsp = 14 g; use high-quality butter for browning
for pan-searing to raise smoke point
optional: add to butter while browning for aroma, remove before serving

steps.text: Prepare the fish: pat sole fillets very dry with paper towels, season both sides lightly with half the salt and half the pepper. Lightly dust each fillet in flour and shake off excess so they are evenly coated but not clumped.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add olive oil. When the oil is shimmering, add two fillets without crowding. Cook undisturbed until the underside is golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.

Carefully flip each fillet and cook the second side until just cooked through and golden, about 1.5 to 2 minutes more. Transfer cooked fillets to a warm plate and keep loosely covered. Repeat with remaining fillets, adding more oil if needed.

In the same skillet over medium heat, reduce heat slightly and add the butter. Swirl and let the butter melt, foam, then continue cooking until solids turn golden-brown and smell nutty, about 2 to 3 minutes. Optional: add smashed garlic during browning for 30–60 seconds and remove before finishing sauce.

Remove skillet from direct heat, stir in lemon juice and lemon zest to stop the butter from cooking further, then stir in chopped parsley and capers if using. Taste and adjust seasoning with remaining salt and pepper.
Spoon the brown butter-lemon sauce over the reserved fillets, or return fillets to the pan for 20–30 seconds to warm and coat. Serve immediately with lemon wedges and extra parsley.
